intro: Erysimum franciscanum, commonly known as the Franciscan mustard, is a herbaceous annual plant native to California. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Erysimum franciscanum is often found in dry, open habitats such as chaparral and coastal scrub.
